page.title: 06Colerne Parish Church
page.content: The chief glory of Colerne is the Church of St John the Baptist.The main features in Colerne Church are the clock and the tower. The clock still works today by winding heavy weights and the unusual thing about it is 300 years old and only has one hand. To get up to the top of the tower we had to climb up a spiral staircase and then go through a small doorway. From the top we could see most of the Domesday area, such as the school and some shops. In the belfry there is one set of eight bells, these can be played in two ways. Each bell has a rope which can be pulled in the normal way by one of the eight bell-ringers or there is a device which enables one person to play hymns on the full set. There are normally two services every Sunday.
